alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 7:38PM EDT until July 12 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rainfall locally upwards to 1 to 2 inches due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall of 0.5 to 1.0 inches is possible before rainfall ends. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Frenchville, New Canada, Cross Lake, Madawaska Lake, Lille, Wallagrass, Grand Isle, Stockholm, Winterville, Westmanland, Guerette, Sinclair, Saint Agatha, Daigle and Soldier Pond. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Minor flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
